statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 10 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 10 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
